name: Audi Quattro A1/A2
details_html: The original revolution — Audi’s Quattro brought all-wheel-drive into rallying, forever changing the sport with its grip and brutal power.

name: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
details_html: The mid-engined, turbocharged 205 T16 crushed the Group B competition with its balance of power, agility, and reliability, dominating the mid-1980s.

name: Lancia Delta S4
details_html: A twin-charged monster — supercharged and turbocharged — the Delta S4 was one of the fastest and deadliest Group B machines ever built.

name: Ford RS200
details_html: Designed from scratch for Group B, the RS200 featured a mid-engine layout, lightweight frame, and tremendous handling, but arrived too late to fully dominate.

name: MG Metro 6R4
details_html: Britain’s Group B beast, the Metro 6R4 ran a naturally aspirated V6 and featured brutal instant power delivery — wild but less successful.

name: Toyota Celica Twin-Cam Turbo (TA64)
details_html: Built for African endurance, the 'Safari Special' Celica crushed the Safari and Ivory Coast rallies with toughness unmatched even by European rivals.

name: Lancia Delta HF Integrale
details_html: After Group B, the Delta Integrale dominated Group A with unstoppable all-wheel-drive traction, turbocharged punch, and legendary rally consistency.
